content.content:
doc_0000_200.txt:1523: The Supreme Court ruled in Brown v. Board of Education.
doc_0001_200.txt:847: The Supreme Court issued its landmark decision.

1520	Context before the ruling.
  1521	The case was argued in December 1952.
  1522	Chief Justice Earl Warren delivered the opinion.
  1523	The Supreme Court ruled in Brown v. Board of Education (1954) that racial segregation in public schools was unconstitutional.
  1524	This landmark decision overturned Plessy v. Ferguson.
  1525	The ruling had far-reaching implications for civil rights.
  1526	Schools across the nation began the process of desegregation.
  1527	The decision was unanimous, 9-0.
  1528	It remains one of the most significant rulings in American history.
  1529	The case originated in Topeka, Kansas.
